greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle T(n,k), n >= 0, in which n-th row (for n >= 3) lists prime factors of Fibonacci(n) (see A000045), without repetition.
link: T. D. Noe, Rows n=0..1000 of triangle, flattened (using Blair Kelly's data)
J. Brillhart, P. L. Montgomery and R. D. Silverman, Tables of Fibonacci and Lucas factorizations, Math. Comp. 50 (1988), 251-260, S1-S15. Math. Rev. 89h:11002.
maple: with(numtheory): with(combinat): for i from 3 to 50 do for j from 1 to nops(ifactors(fibonacci(i))[2]) do printf(`%d,`, ifactors(fibonacci(i))[2][j][1]) od: od:
xref: Cf. A027748, A022307 (row lengths for n>2), A001221.
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Apr 07 2001
ext: More terms from _James A. Sellers_, Apr 09 2001
